name: Unpack optimized contours
description: Unpacks contours, packed by optimizing collinear steps. If source contours are not optimized, result will be identical to the source.

controls.name: needToProcessDiagonals
controls.caption: Enforce unpacking diagonals
controls.description: If set, this function unpacks also non-horizontal and non-vertical segments of the contours (when they exists): they are converted to a series of segments (1,0) or (0,1). Such "diagonal" segments are usually considered as incorrect and should not appear while scanning binary objects, but can be added to contour array manually.

controls.name: cacheLastContours
controls.caption: Cache last contours
controls.description:
If set, this function checks whether the input contours is the same as while the previous call. In this case, the function returns the previous result very quickly.
There is no sense to set this flag, if the function every time processes different contours — it will be better to save memory. But it is useful, for example, when you need to unpack the same set of not-too-large polygons many times (in "Enforce unpacking diagonals" mode).
